subject: Science
title: How Plates Move
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Plates Move usable.

hook.text: Earth's surface is cracked into about 15 major plates that slowly drift.

buildup.text: They float on the asthenosphere â€” a partially molten layer beneath the crust.

discovery.text: Plates move 2 to 10 cm per year, pushed by mantle convection and ridge push.

twist.text: Some plates carry oceans. Others carry continents. Some carry both.

climax.text: Where plates meet, the most violent geology on Earth happens.

punchline.text: The ground beneath you is always moving. You just can't feel it.
